articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Uzbekistan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Uzbekistan
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Islam Karimov, president of Uzbekistan, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Uzbekistan would grow strong in conformity with common interests and desire of the peoples of the two countries and wished the president and people of Uzbekistan greater successes in their work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Slovakia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Slovakia
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Andrej Kiska, president of Slovakia, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Slovakia would grow stronger in the future.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Vietnam
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Vietnam
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greeting to Truong Tan Sang, president of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, on the occasion of the 69th anniversary of its founding.
					 The message said that the Korean people are pleased that the Vietnamese people have achieved big successes in the efforts to build strong and prosperous Vietnam under the leadership of the Communist Party of Vietnam and sincerely wish them new progress in their future work.
					
					 The message expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and Vietnam would grow stronger true to the intentions of the preceding leaders, wishing the president of Vietnam good health and greater success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju Greets Vietnamese PM
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju Greets Vietnamese PM
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju Monday sent a message of greeting to Nguyen Tan Dung, prime minister of Vietnam, on the occasion of the 69th anniversary of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam.
					 The message expressed belief that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation with a long history and tradition would grow stronger in all fields including economy, wishing the prime minister greater successes in his work for building strong and prosperous Vietnam, true to the behest of President Ho Chi Minh.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a similar message to Pham Binh Minh, deputy prime minister and foreign minister, on the same day.

articles.title: Pyongyang Int'l Pro-Wrestling Games Close
articles.content:
Pyongyang Int'l Pro-Wrestling Games Close
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang International Pro-Wrestling Games closed with due ceremony at the Ryugyong Jong Ju Yong Gymnasium on Sunday.
					 Present there were Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Kanji Inoki, chief director of the Sports Peace Community Association of Japan, and Jang Ung, chairman of the International Martial Arts Games Committee, who are co-chairmen of the organizing committee of the games, Pak Kun Gwang, chairman of the DPRK-Japan Friendship Association, Kim Myong Chol, executive member of the International Martial Arts Games Committee, working people in the city, foreign diplomatic envoys here and their wives, foreign embassy officials, foreign guests and overseas compatriots staying in the homeland.
					
					 Addresses were made at the ceremony.
					
					 Following are the results of the second-day competition at the Pyongyang International Pro-Wrestling Games:
					
					 Standing in men's singles
					
					 Crusher Kawaguchi (Japan), winner; Keisuke Okuda (Japan) loser
					
					 Wang Bin (China), winner; Taka Kunoh (Japan) loser
					
					 Ultimo Dragon (Japan), winner; Heddi French (France) loser
					
					 Bob Sapp (U.S.), winner; Atsushi Sawada (Japan) loser
					
					 Shinichi Suzukawa (Japan), winner; Montanha Silva (Brazil) loser
					
					 Kazuyuki Fujita (Japan), winner; Jerome Le Banner (France) loser
					
					 
					
					  Standing in men's doubles
					
					  Daichi Hashimoto, Shogun Okamoto (Japan), winners; Erik Hammer, Jon Andersen (U.S.) losers
					
					 
					
					 Standing in women's doubles
					
					  Ray, Meiko Satomura (Japan), winners; Kyoko Kimura, Dash Chisako (Japan) losers
					
					 At the awarding-ceremony diplomas and certificates of participation of the games were conferred on pro-wrestlers of different countries.

articles.title: Delegation of Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea Leaves for France, Mongolia
articles.content:
Delegation of Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea Leaves for France, Mongolia
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea led by Chairman Ri Myong Gil left here Monday to visit France and Mongolia.

articles.title: First Vice-Chairman of Russian Federation Council Here
articles.content:
First Vice-Chairman of Russian Federation Council Here
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Alexandr Torshyn, first vice-chairman of the Federation Council of Russia, and his party arrived here Monday.

articles.title: National Educational Experimental Apparatus and Teaching Aids Exhibition and Education Aid Exhibition Open
articles.content:
National Educational Experimental Apparatus and Teaching Aids Exhibition and Education Aid Exhibition Open
Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A national educational experimental apparatus and teaching aids exhibition and education aid exhibition opened with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House here on Monday on the occasion of the 13th National Educational Workers' Meeting.
					Educational institutions at all levels presented to the exhibition thousands of experimental apparatuses, equipment and teaching aids that can help students acquire practical knowledge.
					
					Also presented to the education aid exhibition were different type educational equipment, materials for managing schools and apparatuses for experiment and practice provided by ministries, national institutions and industrial establishments across the country.
					
					Present at the opening ceremony were Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, Han Kwang Bok, department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials of ministries and national institutions, those in the field of education, teachers and kindergarteners.
					
					Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, made an opening address.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Fukuoka Prefectural Japan-DPRK Friendship Association led by Chairman Mamoru Kitahara left here for home Monday.

articles.title: Women's Football Tournament underway in DPRK
articles.content:
Women's Football Tournament underway in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A women's football tournament goes on at the Sosan Football Stadium here, in celebration of the birthday (September 9) of the DPRK. 
					 Eleven teams are taking part in the tournament (Aug. 20-Sept. 9).
					
					 At present, the preliminaries of the tournament are going at the final stage, divided into two groups.
					
					 According to the results of group league matches till Sept. 1, Sobaeksu and Amnokgang teams in group A and Rimyongsu and Pyongyang teams in group B were qualified to advance into the semifinals.
					
					 An official of the DPRK Football Association told KCNA that the teams' tactics and their players' skills further improved and 63 goals were scored in 24 group league matches.
					
					 The semifinals are to be held on Sept. 6 and the finals on Sept. 9.

articles.title: New Stamps Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamps Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK issued new stamps (two sheets and one sheetlet) depicting the Songdowon International Children's Camp.
					 The camp is a world-class children's palace built in the scenic east coast of Korea under the loving care of the Workers' Party of Korea for the posterity.
					
					 One of the sheets shows the statues of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il among Korean and foreign children and the other a picture of supreme leader Kim Jong Un among the participants in the final match for the National Children's Football Tournament held at the camp.
					
					 The sheetlet features different buildings at the camp and children's happy camping life against the background of sunflower.
					
					 Seen in the upper part of each stamp are letters reading "We are the happiest in the world!"

articles.title: DPRK Pays Efforts to Crop Growth Forecast
articles.content:
DPRK Pays Efforts to Crop Growth Forecast
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK is directing bigger efforts to the crop growth forecast.
					 In the country forecast for crop growth is given once every ten days by the crop growth forecast headquarters, which comprises of dignified scientists at the Hydro-meteorological Service and the Academy of Agricultural Science.
					
					 The forecast helps ensure the nation's farm works in right time and on a scientific basis, as it informs of agrometeorological conditions and follow-up technical measures.
					
					 The Hydro-meteorological Service has striven to guarantee the reliability of forecast on such agrometeorological conditions as average temperature, rainfall, percentage of sunshine, soil humidity. Meanwhile, on the basis of weather forecast, the Academy of Agricultural Science has indicated technical measures to be taken for the growth of crops and extermination of harmful insects.
					
					 Each province, too, intensifies the regional crop growth forecast, in close touch with the branches of the Academy and the Service in its area.
					
					 Such brisk crop growth forecast is conducted with the help of the Ministry of Agriculture.

articles.title: Japan Should Ponder Over Consequences of Its Criminal Action against Chongryon: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Japan Should Ponder Over Consequences of Its Criminal Action against Chongryon: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- A delegate of the Japanese government to the 85th meeting of the UN Committee on the Elimination of All Forms of Racial Discrimination in Geneva said that Korean schools in Japan have to sever relations with the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) in order to get government subsidies.
					 This can not but be taken seriously as it is a revelation of Japan's policy of extreme national discrimination, its policy for destroying Chongryon based on bitterness toward the DPRK.
					
					 The measure taken by the Japanese government against the Korean schools is a wanton violation of the humanitarian principles and a grave politically-motivated provocation as it encroaches upon the dignity and interests of the DPRK.
					
					 As known, discrimination has been applied for years to Korean schools over the tuition-free program in Japan.
					
					 Korean schools are for descendents of Koreans who suffered from the forcible drafting committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past. They are legitimate national educational institutions run by Chongryon with the approval of the government.
					
					 They received children of Koreans in Japan for the purposes of helping children get national awareness and acquire qualifications required by a modern society and of bringing up talents who will contribute to the development of the international community including Japan. As is the case with all other foreign schools in Japan Korean schools have strictly abided by norms and regulations in the contents of teaching and operation.
					
					 Japan should fully ensure conditions and environment for education of Korean schools even in the sense of repenting of the crimes of aggression committed by it.
					
					 However, the Japanese reactionaries have inflicted financial burdens on Koreans in Japan in a bid to create psychological stress and, at the same time, worked hard to dampen national self-esteem and pride among Korean students in Japan who are at the stage where their outlook on the world is in the process of forming. 
					
					 They seduced Korean children to go to Japanese schools, saying that they would get aid if they go to Japanese schools in a bid to take them from the fold of Chongryon and prevent the rising generation from learning Korean language and history and thus deprive Koreans in Japan of their national identity.
					
					 It was by no means fortuitous that at the recent meeting delegates of different countries strongly denounced Japan's measure as an expression of racial discrimination in the light of human rights. They questioned what is the reason for discriminating against Korean schools while rendering financial aid to all other schools similar to Korean schools and is it for the simple political reason that the Korean schools are associated with Pyongyang.
					
					 Chongryon can never be subject to suppression by the Japanese reactionaries and Korean children in Japan have the right to be schooled with the same treatment as the Japanese children.
					
					 Now underway between the DPRK and Japan are multi-faceted talks for the improvement of relations to meet the requirements of the times and the desire of the two peoples.
					
					 Now confidence-building is more urgent than ever to build the relations of friendship between the two countries. But the Japanese authorities have openly disclosed their intention to destroy Chongryon, a legitimate overseas Koreans' organization.
					
					 Japan would be well advised to face up to the trend of the times and ponder over the consequences to be entailed by its criminal acts against the Koreans.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Ensuring Peace on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Ensuring Peace on Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- It is the most important issue in defending global peace and preventing a new world war to preserve peace on the Korean peninsula, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentator's article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is the way of ensuring durable peace on the peninsula to put a definite end to the U.S. policy of its forces' permanent presence in south Korea.
					
					 In order to defuse the tension and preserve the security on the peninsula, it is necessary to put the earliest possible end to the U.S.-led nuclear war drills in south Korea and its vicinity.
					
					 In order to ensure peace on the peninsula, it is necessary to have the ghost-like "UN Command" dismantled and force the U.S. troops to pull out of south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. forces in south Korea should be driven out of south Korea without fail as they are a stumbling block perpetuating the division of the country and posing a threat to peace.
					
					 As long as the U.S. forces remain in south Korea and nuclear war drills for aggression are staged periodically, the second Korean war is unavoidable.
					
					 If a peaceful environment is to be created on the peninsula, the UN Security Council should fairly deal with the issue of preserving peace on the peninsula.
					
					 Actions of threatening peace in the world have not ceased and big and small wars have gone on one after another since the end of the Second World War. This is chiefly attributable to the fact that the UNSC is acting a puppet of the U.S., failing to properly perform its function. 
					
					 The reality convinced us that it is only our own strength which is dependable.
					
					 The DPRK will as ever make sustained efforts to defend the sovereignty of the country and preserve peace on the peninsula and positively contribute to ensuring peace and security of the world, holding aloft the banner of Songun, the article concludes.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Put End to Their Saber-rattling against North
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Put End to Their Saber-rattling against North
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Stop to joint military exercises for invading the north is a real and important issue in ensuring peace on the Korean peninsula and improving the inter-Korean relations, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary.
					 It is impossible to defuse mistrust and confrontation between the north and the south nor is it possible to achieve national reconciliation and unity unless an end is put to joint military exercises against the north. This is a lesson taught by history, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities are paying-lip service to dialogue after staging large-scale war drills seriously threatening and blackmailing the other party. This is a mockery and insult to domestic and foreign public protest against the nuclear war racket and a petty trick to evade the responsibility for the acts of pushing the inter-Korean relations to the worst phase through adventurous saber-rattling and cover up their belligerent nature.
					
					 A fundamental solution to the issue is for the south Korean authorities to unconditionally halt the joint military drills they are staging with outsiders.
					
					 No matter how frequently inter-Korean dialogue is held, it is bound to collapse again unless U.S.-south Korea joint military drills are halted.
					
					 This is evidenced by the hard-won inter-Korean high-level contact in February this year. It failed to make any progress, driving the north-south relations into catastrophe. This was because the south Korean authorities frantically kicked up the racket of provocative nuclear war exercises in collusion with foreign forces.
					
					 They should give a clear answer to the question of whether joint military drills with outsiders are more important than the destiny of the nation and improved inter-Korean relations. They should make a policy decision to put an end to the confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north.
					
					 The DPRK will never allow the racket of the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces for north-targeted joint military drills as they escalate confrontation and tensions between the north and the south, disturb dialogue and peace and increase the danger of a nuclear war.

articles.title: S. Korea to Blame for DPRK Cheerleading Squad's Loss of Opportunity to Participate in Asian Games
articles.content:
S. Korea to Blame for DPRK Cheerleading Squad's Loss of Opportunity to Participate in Asian Games
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Public opinions at home and abroad are becoming increasingly critical of the south Korean puppet authorities for barring the DPRK's cheerleading squad from taking part in the Asian Games. Much upset by this, the puppet forces let a spokesman for the Ministry of Unification make poor excuses such as "regret" and "twisted assertion."
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Monday terms it a clumsy farce to falsify the truth about their obstructions that deprived the cheerleading squad of the opportunity to participate in the Games and shift the blame for it onto the DPRK. It goes on:
					
					 One's evil doing will rebound on oneself. The south Korean authorities made clumsy excuses for hushing up the north's notification of its decision not to send the cheerleading squad, talking about "verbal mention" and "unofficial notice." They behaved so because they were afraid of people of broad strata in south Korea angered by the situation created by their anti-reunification racket and their behavior of deliberately taking no action to put it under control.
					
					 The DPRK cheerleading squad's loss of the opportunity to participate in the Games is entirely attributable to the south Korean puppet forces' wrong attitude. With no rhetoric they can excuse themselves for this.
					
					 What the south Korean authorities did against the cheerleading squad is recorded in history as another unpardonable crime committed by them against the nation desirous of national reconciliation and unity and the improved inter-Korean relations. Their action deprived the nation of a good opportunity of improving the inter-Korean relations and stirring up once again the enthusiasm to revive the spirit of the June 15 era of reunification.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should not make a mockery of the Korean nation with words "confidence" and "dialogue".
					
					 With nothing can they conceal their act of doing harm to national reconciliation and unity by abusing even international sports games for confrontation with the north, obsessed by bitterness and unconditional repugnancy toward the fellow countrymen in the north.

articles.title: Repeal of NSL Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repeal of NSL Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Jaju Minbo on August 28 carried an article demanding the repeal of the "National Security Law" (NSL).
					 It is an established fact that the NSL is the evil law which can not be found in any other part of the world, the article said, adding:
					
					 Many people met grievous deaths and many of them have been subject to prison life, torture, forcible search, indictment, trial and other suppression due to the evil law.
					
					 Recently, a U.S. paper carried a sad story about a woman who was tortured in prison after being thrown behind bars on the suspicion of violation of the NSL in 1981. The story said she had to live in exile after being released as it was hard for her to get a job.
					
					 She was given a verdict of not guilty at a retrial three decades later.
					
					 The past history of a woman whose right was abused by the power is a warning signifying the urgent need for the repeal of the NSL.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by British Organizations on Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Posted by British Organizations on Website
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- The main contents of supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Add Eternal Brilliance to Comrade Kim Jong Il's Great Idea and Achievements of the Songun Revolution" were jointly posted by the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on August 24 on website.
					 The work, published on August 25, Juche 102 (2013), clarifies the Songun revolutionary feats of leader Kim Jong Il and the essence and originality of the Songun revolutionary idea and indicates tasks to be fulfilled to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Songun.

articles.title: Day of Songun Observed by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Day of Songun Observed by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried special write-ups and aired special programs on the occasion of the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					 The Uruguayan paper La Juventud on August 24 devoted one full page to an article titled "Day of Songun in DPRK" illustrated with a photo of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army (KPA) on August 25, 1960, an event of weighty significance, the article noted, giving a detailed account of the exploits he performed in building the invincible revolutionary armed forces by inspecting a lot of KPA units till the last moments of his life.
					
					 The Kuwaiti paper Al-Rai on August 22 in an article titled "On the occasion of August 25, the Day of Songun in DPRK. HE Kim Jong Il ushered in new era for building prosperous country by dint of Songun" noted:
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il who defended socialism under the unfurled banner of Songun let the KPA stand in the van of the drive for building a thriving nation.
					
					 The eye-opening reality of the DPRK invincible with the single-minded unity, firm with self-defence and prospering with industrial revolution in the new century would be unthinkable without his Songun leadership exploits.
					
					 HE Kim Jong Un who has successfully carried forward Kim Jong Il's revolutionary cause of Songun is further strengthening the politico-ideological might of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK's Day of Songun will shine further under Kim Jong Un's wise leadership.
					
					 On the same day the Guinean Domestic, International and 7 National Languages Broadcasting Services reported about the Songun leadership feats performed by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Brazilian Political Figure Blasts U.S. Anti-DPRK Human Rights Campaign
articles.content:
Brazilian Political Figure Blasts U.S. Anti-DPRK Human Rights Campaign
 Pyongyang, September 1 (KCNA) -- Rosanita Campos, vice-president of the Party for Free Motherland of Brazil, on Aug. 22 contributed to the Brazilian paper Hora do Povo an article titled "U.S. invents pretext to bring down social system in DPRK".
					 The U.S. is pulling up the DPRK over its non-existent "human rights issue", which is aimed to bring down the socialist system in the DPRK, a country supported by its people, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The hostile forces are laying hurdles in the way of building the economy of the DPRK but it is advancing, firmly defending its sovereignty by its own efforts.
					
					 In the DPRK, the human rights are being thoroughly ensured by law and the government the mission of which is to meet the demand and interests of the people.
					
					 Genuine human rights are the ones for the people.
					
					 As the existence of socialist Korea giving priority to the well-being and interests of the people is contrary to the interests of the U.S., it needed diplomacy of tarnishing the image of the DPRK, the independent and socialist country.
					
					  The U.S. is not entitled to talk about the human rights in socialist Korea.

articles.title: Portavoz de CDN denuncia plan de produccion de pelicula anti-RPDC de Gran Bretana
articles.content:
Portavoz de CDN denuncia plan de produccion de pelicula anti-RPDC de Gran Bretana
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El portavoz del Departamento de Politica del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica la vispera la siguiente declaracion:
					Recientemente, los productores del "4o canal de TV" publicaron abiertamente el plan de producir y proyectar la pelicula en serie con el contenido de calumnia astuta a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					La pelicula persigue inducir en error la realidad como si las armas nucleares de la RPDC fueran producidas con la tecnologia de Gran Bretana "robada ilegalmente".
					
					Esa emisora transmite sin titubeo que la meta de la produccion de la pelicula es para dar a conocer que la RPDC es el "pais mas cerrado" en el mundo y "pais mas amenazante" al Occidente.
					
					La verdad nunca se tapara con nada pese a que los productores disfrazados de mascara de artistas de ese canal britanico trataran de falsificar la realidad.
					
					Nuestra espada nuclear autodefensiva es producto enorgullecedor de la industria de defensa nacional de la epoca del Songun basada en nuestras fuerzas, tecnicas y recursos.
					
					Nuestro poderio nuclear autoctono en el nivel sofisticado de talla mundial es tan fuerte que nadie lo imaginara.
					
					Hasta Estados Unidos, perito de conspiraciones y falsificaciones, no se atreve a  negarlo.
					
					Los que hablan tanto del "robo ilegal de tecnologia nuclear" son los imbeciles carentes de la elemental capacidad para juzgar la  realidad.
					
					La gravedad del caso es que tal farsa se ejecuta bajo la tolerancia y el amparo de "Downing Street" que tiene las relaciones diplomaticas con nuestro pais.
					
					Tal demagogia deviene una planificada provocacion politica y un intencional acto hostil para deshonrar la dignidad maxima de la RPDC, su prestigio independiente y su aspecto exterior.
					
					Francamente dicho, Gran Bretana tiene el caracter innato de imitar sin razonamiento la diplomacia a estilo norteamericano.
					
					Esta vez, cuando una compania de Hollywood de EE.UU anuncio previamente un film reaccionario producido con el contenido de difamacion a la dignidad suprema de la RPDC, la radiodifusion britanica se sumo ciegamente a esta invencion norteamericana.
					
					Las autoridades britanicas no deben olvidar la leccion de haber recibido una sentencia capital  por haber producido una "poesia de diablo" que difama sin razonamiento un Estado del Medio Oriente.
					
					Tal locura anti-RPDC solamente le causara la verguenza y la autodestruccion.
					
					Las autoridades britanicas deben botar de inmediato al basurero sus peliculas reaccionarias en plan o en produccion y castigar a sus involucrados.
					
					Eso convendra a evitar el perjuicio de la honra de Gran Bretana y mantener las relaciones diplomaticas dificilmente preparadas con la RPDC.
					
					Seria bueno que las autoridades britanicas  juzguen por si solo que consecuencia le tocara en caso de no prestar atencion a nuestra advertencia.

articles.title: Clausurada Competencia Internacional de Lucha Profesional de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Clausurada Competencia Internacional de Lucha Profesional de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo clausurada la vispera en el Coliseo Deportivo Jong Ju Yong de Ryugyong la Competencia Internacional de Lucha Profesional de Pyongyang.
					En la ceremonia clausural participaron el ministro de Deportes Kim Yong Hun, los copresidentes del comite organizador de la Competencia Internacional de Lucha Profesional de Pyongyang: el director jefe de la Asociacion de Comunidad de Deportes y Paz de Japon, Kanji Inoki, y el presidente del Comite Internacional de Juegos de Artes Marciales, Jang Ung, asi como el presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Japon Pak Kun Gwang, y el miembro ejecutivo del Comite Internacional de Juegos de Artes Marciales Kim Myong Chol, los trabajadores, jovenes y estudiantes en la capital, los matrimonios de representantes  diplomaticos y miembros de la embajada de varios paises en Corea, huespedes extranjeros y compatriotas en ultramar.
					
					En la cita hubo discursos.
					
					El resultado de la segunda jornada realizada antes de la ceremonia es bajo lo siguiente:
					
					En simple masculino:
					
					Crusher Kawaguchi (Japon) vencio a Keisuke Okuda (Japon); Wang Bin (China), a Taka Kunoh (Japon); Ultimo Tragon (Japon), a Heddi French (Francia); Bob Sapp (Estados Unidos), a Atsushi Sawada (Japon); Shinichi Suzukawa (Japon), a Montanha Silva (Brasil); Kazuyuki Fujita (Japon), a Jerome Le Banner (Francia).
					
					En doble masculino:
					
					Taichi Hashimoto y Shogun Okamoto (Japon) vencieron a Erik Hammer y Jon Andersen (Estados Unidos). 
					
					En doble femenino:
					
					Ray y Meiko Satomura (Japon) vencieron a Kyoko Kimura, Dash Chisako (Japon).
					
					Terminada la competencia hubo premiacion.
					
					Se otorgo a los luchadores profesionales diploma y el certificado de participacion.

articles.title: Inauguradas exposiciones vinculadas con educacion
articles.content:
Inauguradas exposiciones vinculadas con educacion
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- En ocasion de la XIII Conferencia Nacional de los Funcionarios de Ensenanza, quedaron inauguraron hoy en esta capital la Exhibicion Nacional de los Aparatos de Ensayo de Educacion y Articulos de Ensenanza y la exposicion de apoyo a la educacion.
					En la primera cita los organos docentes a todos niveles presentaron miles de aparatos de ensayo, equipos y medios de ensenanza que contribuiran a hacer que los alumnos obtengan los conocimientos utiles.
					
					En la exposicion de apoyo a la educacion se exhibieron los equipos de ensenanza de diversos generos, los materiales de administracion y los aparatos de experimento y practica preparados por los ministerios, organos centrales, fabricas y empresas de diversas localidades.
					
					La ceremonia de inauguracion tuvo lugar en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones con la participacion del vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, el jefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Han Kwang Bok, los funcionarios de ministerios, organos centrales y de la rama de educacion, los maestros y educadoras.
					
					La palabra inaugural estuvo a cargo de Kim Sung Du, presidente del Comite de Educacion.

articles.title: ACNC censura disparates de representante japones en reunion de ONU
articles.content:
ACNC censura disparates de representante japones en reunion de ONU
Pyongyang, 1 de septiembre (ACNC) -- En la 85a reunion del comite de liquidacion de discriminacion racial de la ONU, celebrada en Ginebra, el representante del gobierno japones dijo que para recibir los subsidios gubernamentales, las escuelas coreanas en Japon deben cortar las relaciones con la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon).
					Esto es una demostracion de la extremada politica de discriminacion nacional, la de aplastamiento de Japon a la Chongryon, basada en la conciencia hostil contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Tales medidas discriminatorias del gobierno japones sobre las escuelas coreanas resultan la violacion flagrante del principio humanitario y la grave provocacion politica que infringe la dignidad e interes de la RPDC.
					
					Como todos conocen, perdura durante varios anos la actitud discriminatoria de Japon en materia de la aplicacion del sistema de apoyo a las escuelas superiores sobre las escuelas coreanas.
					
					En las escuelas de coreanos estudian los descendientes de los coreanos danados por los crimenes de reclutamiento forzoso hechos en el pasado por los imperialistas japoneses.
					
					Como centros docentes legitimos, que administra Chongryon bajo el permiso del gobierno japones, las escuelas coreanas han venido recibiendo a los hijos de todos los coreanos residentes en Japon tomando como su meta de educacion la elevacion de capacidad segun la conciencia nacional y la demanda de la sociedad moderna y la formacion de personas talentosas capaces de contribuir al desarrollo de la sociedad internacional incluso Japon.
					
					Tambien cumplieron cabalmente las reglas correspondientes en el contenido de ensenanza y  administracion como lo hacen otras escuelas extranjeras en Japon.
					
					En el sentido de reflexionar de sus crimenes de agresion a Corea, Japon debe brindar merecidamente las condiciones y el ambiente de educacion de las escuelas coreanas.
					
					A pesar de esto, los reaccionarios japoneses intentan crear la sensacion de presion psicologica entre los coreanos residentes en Japon acarreandoles el cargo financiero y castrar la dignidad y el orgullo nacional entre los alumnos coreanos residentes en Japon. 
					
					Al decir que si los alumnos coreanos estudian en las escuelas japonesas pueden recibir la ayuda, intentan separarlos de la Chongryon y exterminar la nacionalidad de los coreanos residentes en Japon haciendo que las nuevas generaciones no aprendan el idioma y la historia de Corea.
					
					En esta reunion los representantes de varios paises criticaron cual era la verdadera razon de Japon que discrimina las escuelas coreanas mientras presta la ayuda financiera a otras escuelas semejantes con ellas y preguntaron que su causa es que ellas estan relacionadas simplemente con Pyongyang. Y criticaron severamente que al partir de vista de DDHH, esto pertenece a la discriminacion racial.
					
					La Chongryong no puede ser el blanco de represion de los reaccionarios japoneses y los alumnos coreanos residentes en Japon tienen el derecho a estudiar recibiendo el igual  tratamiento como los japoneses.
					
					En los ultimos dias, la RPDC y Japon realizan las conversaciones de varias ramas por la mejora de las relaciones bilaterales segun la demanda de la epoca y la aspiracion de los pueblos de ambos paises.
					
					En el tiempo en que se demanda apremiantemente mas que nunca la creacion de confianza por la mejora de las relaciones de amistad Corea-Japon, las autoridades japonesas expresaron en la escena internacional la abierta intencion de exterminar la Chongryon, entidad legitima de ciudadanos ultramarinos de la RPDC.
					
					?Como debemos juzgarlo?
					
					Japon debe ver correctamente la corriente de la epoca y reflexionar de la consecuencia que se emane en caso de que perpetre otra vez el crimen ante la nacion coreana.
